page.title: 10 BENSTEAD HOUSE HOSPITAL
page.content: This is an old people's home and hospital.The original building,in the shape of a square with central yards, was built in 1835 at a cost of 6000 pounds.It was run by the Board of Guardians but the hospital is now run by Kent area health and the residential home by the K.C.C.The difference is that the hospital needs nursing care and the home does not.At the moment there are 56 beds.It was all built at the same time but a new residential home for 20 and a day centre for 30 is being built and will be ready in September or October 1986.There are about 9 bedrooms with 4 or 5 in each one.The family of Gange were doctors who worked at Benstead House over 114 years,the last dying about 4 years ago. A new unit to replace the hospital ward will be finished by 1988.
